info.game_comments: WE ASKED: TV creator Vince Gilligan.

(1, 1).clue: In 2013, Anthony Foxx got this job in Obama's cabinet

(2, 1).clue: It's the one compass direction you can go from 90 degrees north latitude

(3, 1).clue: Many thought John Hammes was a madman when he created the InSinkErator, one of the first of these

(4, 1).clue: In 1858 a discovery along the Fraser River in British Columbia led to a gold rush in this country

(5, 1).clue: A "Definitive Edition" of her diary includes previously unknown entries that were discovered in 1998

(6, 1).clue: The 2015 Brian Wilson biopic "Love & Mercy" depicts the making of this group's "Pet Sounds"

(1, 2).clue: New kid name on the block:For 2013 this boat builder became the top U.S. baby boy name

(2, 2).clue: It precedes "state" in a word for the direction from Chicago to Carbondale

(3, 2).clue: Irwin Cox answered a distress call when he invented this brand of steel-wool pads, found in kitchen sinks since 1917

(4, 2).clue: An oil boom using modern techniques in this Prairie State has made it second in crude production in the U.S. behind Texas

(5, 2).clue: Christopher Buckley wrote the introduction for the 50th anniversary edition of this Joseph Heller novel

(1, 3).clue: Ms. de Laurentiis is a new kid on the Las Vegas Strip with her first restaurant, simply called this name

(2, 3).clue: Direction from St. Louis to Dallas, or airline that will take you on the trip

(3, 3).clue: To the joy of dish washers, in 1960 DuPont introduced cookware coated with the nonstick polymer known by this trade name

(5, 3).clue: Color photos of the title pond & woods were part of the 150th anniversary edition of this work by Thoreau

(6, 3).clue: This British duo revived the career of Dusty Springfield when she joined them on "What Have I Done To Deserve This?"

(1, 4).clue: In 2015 this African-American journalist became the anchor of the "NBC Nightly News"

(2, 4).clue: Direction on a map from Iran to Iraq, or proverbial direction to find the indie stations on the radio dial

(6, 4).clue: When is a "boy" band not a boy band?  We nominate this country group with the name of a Tennessee atomic research city

(2, 5).clue: Willem Barents sailed in this direction from Amsterdam to the Barents Sea; he was looking for this passage

(3, 5).clue: Food residue in the enameled cast-iron cookware from this brand whose name is French for "cauldron"; it's okay to let it soak

(4, 5).clue: Discovery of the "Eureka" diamond began the 1870s rush to this South African mining town bearing a feminine name

(5, 5).clue: To celebrate this red-haired girl's 75th birthday, a 2014 edition of her kids' book included a pop-up panorama of Paris

(6, 5).clue: When is a "boy" band totally a boy band?  We nominate this group who wanted us to "Quit Playing Games (With My Heart)", baby

(1, 1).clue: For her thesis, she wondered if elements other than uranium exhibited radioactivity; that won her a Nobel

(2, 1).clue: After his victory at Austerlitz in 1805, Napoleon began building this structure to honor the French army

(3, 1).clue: We always hear about this French word preceding "riche", but it also is found in front of "pauvre" for a newly poor person

(4, 1).clue: Referring to a line of charismatic leaders of Israel, it's the only book title in the first 10 that's an occupation

(5, 1).clue: This clothing term refers to inexpensive mass-produced jewelry

(6, 1).clue: Here's Snoopy as a World War I flying ace in the new "Peanuts" movie, still pursuing this nemesis--"Curse you!"

(1, 2).clue: She asked Annie Sullivan, "What is love?" & wondered, "Is love the sweetness of flowers?"

(2, 2).clue: This London landmark stands on the site of an old Benedictine monastery

(4, 2).clue: This book of the Pentateuch has a Latin name & is mostly concerned with priests & their duties

(6, 2).clue: Michelle Pfeiffer & Halle Berry have both played this transformed character with heightened powers

(1, 3).clue: Paula Cole wondered, "Where is my John Wayne?" in the song that asks, "Where Have All" these "Gone?"

(3, 3).clue: A quilt comforter, from the French for "down"

(4, 3).clue: "Now after the death of Moses", begins this, the first Bible book called by a man's name

(6, 3).clue: (Vince Gilligan, creator of Breaking Bad, delivers the clue.)  I said, "No matter what nuclear holocaust or plague may occur, this Bob Odenkirk character will "wind up scurrying out into the sunlight after everybody else is gone"

(1, 4).clue: From her window Juliet asks, "O Romeo, Romeo!" this question

(2, 4).clue: 165 billion times actual size, the Atomium in Brussels represents this type of solid made up of nine iron atoms

(3, 4).clue: Babs could tell you this fleshy cone at the back of the throat keeps food from entering the nasal passages

(4, 4).clue: The Book of Numbers is this number book in the Bible

(5, 4).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from a dock on Rangiroa Atoll.)  To culture black pearls, an irritant is inserted into a black-lipped oyster, & during the next two years, thousands of layers of this substance build over the irritant

(1, 5).clue: Why should women wear corsets?  This French designer said, "Luxury must be comfortable, otherwise it is not luxury"

(0, 0).clue: As she arrived at the house of her new employer, "the wind seemed to catch her up into the air and fling her" at the door
